task_summary: Perceive the T-block and target, approach and align, set yaw, push the block along the table toward the target marker, verify arrival, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace until it reaches a marked target area. The sequence begins with perception of both the block and the target, followed by an overhead approach and fine in-plane alignment. The tool yaw is set to a convenient orientation and a single long push is executed toward the target. After motion, the system verifies proximity to the goal and safely retreats, respecting 10 Hz sensing/control constraints.
preconditions: Workspace is clear and the T-block is on the table.
Target marker is visible in the camera view.
Robot has kinematic reach to block and target.
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and approach for contact.
Align precisely to the push face; set end-effector yaw.
Push the block toward the target along a straight direction.
Verify arrival near the target marker.
success_criteria: T-block final pose overlaps or is centered within the target marker.
No collision with fixtures; robot ends in a safe pose.
failure_and_recovery: Slip or misalignment: re-align and issue an additional push.
Overshoot: execute a corrective push in the opposite direction.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the target condition is satisfied and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move to a pre-contact pose above the block.
Refine alignment to the block for pushing.
Orient end-effector for a straight push.
Push the block toward the target.
Verify and tidy alignment at goal.
Back off safely from the object.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to glare or occlusion
recovery_strategy: Abort and retreat if contact becomes unsafe
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue marker; instruction mentions gray block and green target—treated as the same objects by role.
Push direction assumed toward the right (0°) based on apparent motion in frames.
10 Hz rates inform conservative timeouts but are not explicit BT parameters.

expected_success_criteria: T-block center overlaps the target marker within a small tolerance and robot retreats.
